problem_summary_simple: Check if a number can be formed by summing distinct powers of three.
problem_summary_technical: Convert the number to base-3; valid if no digit is '2'.
key_insights: Any number can be uniquely represented in base-3 using digits 0, 1, and 2.
If a number is a sum of distinct powers of three, its base-3 representation will only contain digits 0 and 1.
The modulo 3 operation effectively extracts the least significant digit in base-3.
